revised_title: Temperature-Dependent Foraging Behavior in Atlantic Salmon
tldr: This study shows that juvenile Atlantic salmon switch between diurnal and nocturnal foraging based on environmental temperature, regardless of photoperiod and season. As the temperature drops below 10°C, the salmon become more nocturnal, hiding during the day and emerging at night to feed. This behavior is linked to changes in the fish's physiology and social structure, which may help maximize feeding efficiency in summer while reducing predation risk in winter.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Ecology and Ethology
